welcomeMessage: Hi **@chauler**, how can I help you?

response.value:
Snippet with error: `<marquee>Hospital Management System</marquee>`
Location of error: Inside the `<header>` tag
WCAG Guideline violated: 2.2.2 Pause, Stop, Hide (Level A)
Detection Algorithm: Check if the `<marquee>` tag is used.
Explanation of Error: The `<marquee>` tag is deprecated and it creates moving content that cannot be paused, stopped, or hidden, which can be distracting or disorienting for some users.

---

Snippet with error: `<video width="400" controls> <source src="hospital_video.mp4" type="video/mp4"> Your browser does not support the video tag. </video>`
Location of error: Inside the `#home` section
WCAG Guideline violated: 1.2.3 Audio Description or Media Alternative (Prerecorded) (Level A)
Detection Algorithm: Check if the `<video>` tag is used without a `<track>` tag for captions.
Explanation of Error: The video does not have captions or a text alternative, making it inaccessible to people who are deaf or hard of hearing.

---

Snippet with error: `<label for="name"></label>`
Location of error: Inside the form in the `#contact` section
WCAG Guideline violated: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships (Level A)
Detection Algorithm: Check if the `<label>` tag is empty.
Explanation of Error: The label for the name input field is empty, which can make it difficult for screen reader users to understand what information should be entered in the field.

---

Snippet with error: `<meta http-equiv="refresh" content="0">`
Location of error: Just before the `<footer>` tag
WCAG Guideline violated: 2.2.1 Timing Adjustable (Level A)
Detection Algorithm: Check if the `<meta>` tag with `http-equiv="refresh"` attribute is used.
Explanation of Error: This tag is used to refresh the page automatically, which can disorient and confuse users, especially those with cognitive disabilities.

followups.message: What are some best practices for creating accessible HTML forms?

b.description: Ask Copilot or type / for commands

metadata.helpTextPrefix: You can ask me general programming questions, or chat with the following participants which have specialized expertise and can perform actions:
metadata.helpTextVariablesPrefix: You can also help me understand your question by using the following variables to give me extra context:

helpTextPostfix.value:
To have a great conversation, ask me questions as if I was a real programmer:

* **Show me the code** you want to talk about by having the files open and selecting the most important lines.
* **Make refinements** by asking me follow-up questions, adding clarifications, providing errors, etc.
* **Review my suggested code** and tell me about issues or improvements, so I can iterate on it.

You can also ask me questions about your editor selection by [starting an inline chat session](command:inlineChat.start).

Learn more about [GitHub Copilot](https://docs.github.com/copilot/using-github-copilot/getting-started-with-github-copilot?tool=vscode&utm_source=editor&utm_medium=chat-panel&utm_campaign=2024q3-em-MSFT-getstarted) in [Visual Studio Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/overview).

b.name: GitHub Copilot

metadata.helpTextPrefix: You can ask me general programming questions, or chat with the following participants which have specialized expertise and can perform actions:
metadata.helpTextVariablesPrefix: You can also help me understand your question by using the following variables to give me extra context:

To have a great conversation, ask me questions as if I was a real programmer:

* **Show me the code** you want to talk about by having the files open and selecting the most important lines.

response.value:
Snippet with error: `<html lang="en">`
Location of error: At the start of the HTML document
WCAG Guideline violated: 3.1.1 Language of Page (Level A)
Detection Algorithm: Check if the `lang` attribute in the `<html>` tag matches the actual language of the page content.
Explanation of Error: The `lang` attribute is set to "en" (English), but if the actual content of the page is not in English, this can cause problems for screen reader users.

---

Snippet with error: `<video width="400" controls> <source src="hospital_video.mp4" type="video/mp4"> Your browser does not support the video tag. </video>`
Location of error: Inside the `#home` section
WCAG Guideline violated: 1.2.5 Audio Description (Prerecorded) (Level AA)
Detection Algorithm: Check if the `<video>` tag is used without a description track.
Explanation of Error: The video does not have an audio description, which makes it inaccessible to people who are blind or have low vision.

---

Snippet with error: `<section id="home">...</section>`
Location of error: Home section
WCAG Guideline violated: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships (Level A)
Detection Algorithm: Check if the `<section>` tag is used without an aria-label or aria-labelledby attribute.
Explanation of Error: The section does not have an aria-label or aria-labelledby attribute, which can make it difficult for screen reader users to understand the purpose of the section.

---

Snippet with error: `<button type="submit">Submit</button>`
Location of error: Inside the form in the `#contact` section
WCAG Guideline violated: 4.1.2 Name, Role, Value (Level A)
Detection Algorithm: Check if the `<button>` tag is used without an aria-label or aria-labelledby attribute.
Explanation of Error: The button does not have an aria-label or aria-labelledby attribute, which can make it difficult for screen reader users to understand the purpose of the button.

---

Snippet with error: `<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">`
Location of error: Inside the `<head>` tag
WCAG Guideline violated: 1.4.4 Resize text (Level AA)
Detection Algorithm: Check if the `maximum-scale`, `minimum-scale`, or `user-scalable=no` parameters are used in the `content` attribute of the `<meta name="viewport">` tag.
Explanation of Error: The viewport meta tag does not restrict zooming, which is good for accessibility. However, if the rest of the page is not designed to work well at increased zoom levels, this can still result in an accessibility issue.

followups.message: What are some best practices for improving the accessibility of HTML code?
